title: var, let, and const in JavaScript

sections.heading: ðŸ”¹ Introduction
content: In JavaScript, variables can be declared using var, let, and const. Each has different scoping rules and use cases.

sections.heading: ðŸ”¹ var
content: The var keyword is function-scoped and was the traditional way to declare variables before ES6.

sections.heading: ðŸ”¹ let
content: The let keyword allows you to declare block-scoped variables. It's preferable over var for most use cases.

sections.heading: ðŸ”¹ const
content: The const keyword is also block-scoped and is used to declare constants. Once assigned, the value cannot be changed.
